title: "Act of Congress" defined
context: §212-1 &ldquo;Act of Congress&rdquo; defined. As used in this chapter, &ldquo;Act of Congress&rdquo; means the act of Congress approved June 18, 1934, entitled, &ldquo;An act to provide for the establishment, operation, and maintenance of foreign-trade zones in ports of entry of the United States, to expedite and encourage foreign commerce, and for other purposes&rdquo;, and the amendments thereto. [L 1963, c 7, §2; Supp, §98T-2; HRS §212-1]
